Senior Clinical Business Analyst
 - (3153803)
About Us:
As a not-for-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Partners HealthCare supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.

We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Partners HealthCare is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.

Our employees use the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.

General Summary/Overview Statement
The Senior Clinical Business Analyst is a member of the group supporting Brigham Health clinical systems for Brigham & Women’s Hospital, Brigham and Women’s Faulkner Hospital, and its affiliates. The specifics associated with the Senior Clinical Business Analyst role are described in the attached position summary.

Position Summary
This role supports clinical users of Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Brigham and Women’s Faulkner Hospital, and acts as the key liaison between the operational and clinical community and Enterprise teams. The Senior Clinical Business Analyst will use their knowledge of application functionality, system processes and clinical workflows to provide exceptional customer support and troubleshooting. Support consists of but is not limited to in person support in patient care areas, remote, on-call and ticket-based support with adherence to documented service level targets.
The person in this role is primarily focused on the Epic Stork application and vendor/complementary applications used in the Connors Center for Women and Newborns (CWN) space, with a secondary focus on other Epic inpatient related applications that the team is responsible for. These applications include, but are not limited to Epic Inpatient Orders, Beacon, Clin Doc, Willow, Reporting Workbench, and any complementary/vendor applications supported by the Inpatient team.

This role requires an individual who can function effectively and independently with minimal direction. The Senior Clinical Business Analyst will collaborate with multiple disciplines, organize, and prioritize work, and find solutions to complex problems.
Under the direction of the Manager for Brigham Health Clinical Inpatient Information Systems, the individual in this role will:
Serve as Stork application expert for troubleshooting, developing, and designing effective solutions to business problems. Support and/or direct staff with CWN/Stork related requests and on-call issues.
Elicit requirements and business needs in the CWN space and translate into functional specifications using Business Analysis tools and methodologies.
Interview and observe clinical end users and business stakeholders to understand workflows, processes, business rules, and systems in use.
Proactively facilitates ongoing review of upcoming Stork enhancements or system changes and coordinates with stakeholders to develop plans to operationalize and communicate change, including creating and/or updating tip sheets and training/communication materials.
Act as primary liaison between clinical business/end users and Mass General Brigham Digital Health eCare and Enterprise teams to resolve issues, advocate for the department and collaborate on project/enhancement requests from design/initial requirement elicitation through testing and implementation.
Understands user requirements; translates them to functional requirements and assists end users with Epic standard services, distributed build, enhancement, and project/demand request submissions. Supports BH CWN IT Governance group in reviewing and prioritizing requests.
Collaborate with the CWN IT Oversight Chairs and Oversight Group to develop meeting agendas, facilitate meetings, and create training materials, including, but not limited to tip sheets, demos, presentations.
Communicates constraints to business owners and negotiate trade offs.
Participate in Clinical Systems On-Site Support rotation, providing in-person support at BWH/BWF main campuses and distributed offsite locations
Provide off hours (weekends and/or evenings) on-site support multiple times per year for Epic upgrades and other organizational project Go-Lives.
Participate in Clinical Systems On-Call Rotation, as directed by manager.
Act as manager delegate.
Own or manage Clinical Systems defined program, as directed by manager.
Create and run reports as needed using tools such as Epic Reporting Workbench, Microsoft Access, and ServiceNow.
Fulfills standard service requests through build in Epic as defined through Distributed Build program.
Complete work assignments in accordance with established timelines. Maintains a strong understanding of business priorities and objectives. Uses this knowledge to prioritize work while managing multiple complex assignments.

Principle Duties and Responsibilities
Provide on-going application support for all team supported applications. Support responsibilities include but are not limited to educating and answering end user “how to” questions through on-site, on-call and telephone support, system maintenance activities, system enhancements and upgrades.
Recognized as a source of expert knowledge and proactively functions in that capacity when sought after by others.
Responsible for gathering, compiling, and synthesizing information related to business processes, systems capabilities and end user needs and translating them into functional requirements, use cases, workflow diagrams, and other forms of documentation where applicable.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of core business processes and clinical workflows. Understands application and relationship to business/clinical workflow. Ensures questions/ issues are addressed asking the right questions.
Accurately identifies, defines, and communicates business problem and solution scope. Recognizes improvement opportunities and effectively presents recommendations to stakeholders. Documents the business needs of the future solution (develop business requirement documents) and evaluates technical and operational feasibility.
Effectively analyze and resolve complex issues. Identifies the “root cause” of problem quickly and begins problem resolution. Facilitates appropriate escalation for timely resolution.
Develops and executes user acceptance testing plans, including creation of test cases.
Attends and participates in team, project, and department meetings to increase awareness and information flow.
Plan, manage, and over-see mid-large projects utilizing recognized project management techniques and methodologies.
Provide status reporting regarding project milestones, deliverable, dependencies, risks, and issues, communicating across leadership.
Analyze business processes to ensure accurate system configuration and to identify inefficiencies and opportunities for improved effectiveness. Review and recommend best practices for business analysis, training, and end user support functions.
Assign/delegate project and application related task assignments as appropriate, and monitor quality of work performed. Provide direction and guidance to team members when applicable to facilitate timely and quality results.
Participate in resource planning efforts for both project/program and support activities.
Provide training to and serve as a mentor for junior Clinical Business Analysts and/or other appropriate project team members; manage and evaluate work products for assigned team members.
Use the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions, and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.
Other duties as assigned.

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, IT, Healthcare, or related required; Master’s Degree Preferred
Must have 8 years of healthcare IT experience with a knowledge of clinical systems
A combination of education and experience may be substituted for requirements
Epic Certification desired or must obtain Epic training as outlined by program requirement

Skills/Abilities/Competencies Required
Demonstrated experience in end user management, preferably in a healthcare setting
Deep knowledge and understanding of clinical workflows
Ability to effectively translate business requirements to functional requirements
Excellent interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with cross functional teams including staff at all levels of the organization including both technical and non-technical personnel
Exceptional problem solving and negotiation skills
Ability to effectively conduct meetings, both formal and informal including departmental and clinical user meetings
Ability to lead and facilitate large working sessions with all levels of staff
Self-motivated, independent and possesses the ability to learn quickly
Ability to successfully negotiate and collaborate with others of different skill sets, backgrounds, and levels within and external to the organization

An SEI Consultant is a master communicator and active listener who understands how to navigate an audience. Self-aware, almost to a fault, SEI consultants keenly understand how to adjust their approach based on the situation. Following a logical, fact-based approach, our consultants possess the superior ability to see correlations others may not, ask the right questions and drive solutions.

As super-connectors, our consultants connect not only people, but data, trends and experiences. Mature, humble, and genuine, SEI Consultants frequently go above and beyond for both their clients and their colleagues. SEI Consultants are ethical and trustworthy individuals who do what they say. SEI Consultants have an insatiable curiosity and love to learn. These individuals are commonly tech savvy and early adopters. Their passion for learning is infectious and excites others.

As every project is different, an SEI Consultant must be adaptable and comfortable with unexpected situations. An SEI Consultant must be at ease with ambiguity because although a client knows that a problem exists – they need SEI to figure it out and drive a solution. SEI Consultants define ambition differently. SEI Consultants are authentic, low-maintenance individuals who like to hang out with colleagues outside of work. Whether it be cooking, traveling, hiking, or volunteering, SEI Consultants enjoy working with genuine, thoughtful folks who want to steer clear of the traditional grind and share the joy of day-to-day life and activities with colleagues, friends and family.

WHAT WE DO

Our consultants work with clients at all levels of the organization, from the C-suite to the shop floor, helping them to deliver on their most strategic initiatives. We’re known for making realistic, data-driven decisions that deliver value in tangible ways to our clients. Our clients ask for us on projects that require a superior combination of technical and business capabilities, people and management skills, and a collaborative mindset. We excel in understanding complex programs and strategic initiatives and breaking them into actionable pieces.

We work across a variety of industries and business functions and provide depth and breadth of experience across a core set of service areas:

Agile Transformation and Delivery Analytics and Business Intelligence Business Process & Transformation Organizational Change Management Information Management & Data Governance Program & Project Leadership & Execution Strategic Planning Vendor & Technology Selection User Experience (UX)

A career at SEI extends well beyond providing great service and thought leadership to our clients. Everyone takes an active role in building and managing our business, in an environment that runs counter to traditional consulting firms. Our consultants have a "seat at the table" and contribute to growing our business in ways that align to their interests such as growing business development opportunities, conducting interviews to support our hiring process, managing internal initiatives that build our brand or organizing trainings to share what you know with your colleagues. There is no telling what an SEI Consultant will be asked to do on a day-to-day basis – we do what it takes to get the job done.

QUALIFICATIONS

Required

Demonstrated business acumen Proven track record of delivering results Experience working with and/or leading a team Ability to work independently Ability to work across industries, roles, functions & technologies Positive can-do attitudeAuthorization for permanent employment in the United States (this position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship)

Preferred

Bachelor’s degree Minimum 8+ years professional experience Consulting experience Experience across our service offerings Professional certifications (e.g. PMP , Scrum, Agile)

Business Intelligence Analyst

Company DescriptionButterfly Network's mission is to democratize healthcare by enabling universal access to superior medical imaging. We reinvented ultrasound technology by creating the world's first handheld, single-probe whole-body ultrasound system: the Butterfly iQ. This innovative technology reduces the cost of the traditional ultrasound system by miniaturizing it onto a single semiconductor silicon chip.

Butterfly harnesses the advantages of AI and cloud computing to deliver advanced imaging that is easy-to-use and built for the digital era.The Butterfly iQ and next-generation Butterfly iQ+ have received CE Mark and FDA clearance, and are being sold in hospitals and clinics around the globe.

Joining Butterfly Network is the opportunity to redesign the future of healthcare through the power of technology. Embark on a journey with us to maximize global impact, motivated by the idea that our products will change the lives of millions along with the people you love.Job DescriptionButterfly Network is looking for an exceptional analyst to partner closely with the finance team in developing reporting and insights. You will work with stakeholders in the finance team to create, maintain and communicate metrics that reflect their goals. Additionally, you will develop analysis and tools that allow stakeholders to uncover new insights and opportunities. The ideal candidate will combine strong quantitative skills with excellent communication ability. Importantly, you will bring a passion for helping us fulfill our mission to democratize medical imaging.

As part of our team, your core responsibilities will be:


Working with team leaders to define KPIs for their areas
Building robust SQL data pipelines to calculate these KPIs and supporting drilldowns
Proactively and independently work with stakeholders to construct use cases and associated standardized outputs.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Perform a broad variety of tasks in support of the role and responsibilities.

QualificationsBaseline skills/experiences/attributes:


Bachelor's or higher degree in a quantitative field
4+ years experience in an analytical role
Expert knowledge of SQL
Clear and structured communicator

Ideally, you also have these skills/experiences/attributes (but it's ok if you don't!):


Experience working with data extracted from Salesforce and Netsuite
Experience with BigQuery, Git and Jinja templates
Experience with Tableau

You Deeply Identify with Core Butterfly Network Values:


Efficient & Speedy - you get work done in a fraction of the time as industry peers
Intellectually Curious - you are thoughtful & inquisitive; people enjoy working with you because they learn from you
Mission-Driven & Committed - you are passionate about the company's purpose and are immensely productive
Team Oriented - you celebrate and take joy in the success of others on the team

Additional InformationWe offer great perks:


Fully covered medical insurance plan, and dental & vision coverage - as a health-tech company, we place great worth on our teams' well-being
Competitive salaried compensation - we value our employees and show it
Equity - we want every employee to be a stakeholder
Pre-tax commuter benefits - we make your commute more reasonable
Free onsite meals + kitchen stocked with snacks.
401k plan - we facilitate your retirement goals
Beautiful office overlooking the Flatiron building in NYC
The opportunity to build a revolutionary healthcare product and save millions of lives!

For this role, we provide visa assistance for qualified candidates.

Butterfly network does not accept agency resumes.

Butterfly Network Inc. is an E-Verify Company and is an equal opportunity employer regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or Veteran status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Economics Analyst (Cambridge, MA, Fairfax, VA or Durham, NC location)ICF’s Regulatory, Policy and Economics business portfolio supports primarily public-sector clients with research, analysis, technical assistance, and implementation support to help them address complex policy, management, and regulatory challenges. We estimate the costs, benefits, and economic impacts of regulations, policies, and programs. We also evaluate program effectiveness. We work with virtually all federal agencies and with state and local agencies and select non-profit and private-sector clients. Our key clients include the Environmental Protection Agency, Department of Transportation, Department of Homeland Security, Department of Labor, Department of Interior, and the Nuclear Regulatory Commission.What You Will Be Doing :As Economics Analyst, you will work within an interdisciplinary team conducting applied research and providing consulting services in support of national-level programs focused primarily on addressing a range of environmental, safety, and natural resources management issues. You may also work on environmental justice, energy, and other policy issues.You will lead research and quantitative analyses and conduct regulatory and policy analyses for our clients. Your duties may include analysis and synthesis of economic and resource valuation literature, cost-benefit analyses, statistical/econometrics and other quantitative analyses, development of analytical methods, databases, and models, as well as other program support. The bulk of your work will be on domestic regulatory issues, on topics related to environmental quality, transportation safety, risk management, and human and ecosystem health.You will work in collaboration with senior and junior staff. You will also have direct contact with clients and will contribute to expanding our business.What you need to be a successful candidate for this role:Master’s degree in economics, resource/environmental economics, public policy, or a related discipline with an outstanding academic record. Some experience in a consulting and/or applied research setting is preferred.Course work in economics, environmental/resource economics, finance, statistics and econometrics is required. Course work in biology, physical and/or environmental sciences is a plus.As this is a client-facing role, excellent oral and written communication skills are essential.We need someone who works well on teams. You need to be flexible and able to work in a fast-paced environment. We hire problem-solvers with strong analytical skills that have a high level of attention to detail and a demonstrated ability to apply a variety of technical skill sets to complex problems.Demonstrated skills (through employment or academic coursework) in the following areas are preferred: Policy and regulatory analysis methods; Working with economic, environmental, and/or survey data.Proficiency using data analysis and statistical software packages such as R, Python, SAS, or Stata.Knowledge of issues of environmental and natural resource regulation and policy, particularly as pertains to programs under the Clean Water Act, Safe Drinking Water Act, and other federal laws is also a plus.#Indeed#LI-CC1Working at ICFWorking at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Smart, compassionate, innovative, committed, ICF employees tackle unprecedented challenges to benefit people, businesses, and governments around the globe. We believe in collaboration, mutual respect, open communication, and opportunity for growth. If you’re seeking to make a difference in the world, visit www.icf.com/careers to find your next career. job_title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst - Credit & Market Risk, VP
description: Why this role is important to usOur technology function, Global Technology Services (GTS), is vital to State Street and is the key enabler for our business to deliver data and insights to our clients. We’re driving the company’s digital transformation and expanding business capabilities using industry best practices and advanced technologies such as cloud, artificial intelligence and robotics process automation.We offer a collaborative environment where technology skills and innovation are valued in a global organization. We’re looking for top technical talent to join our team and deliver creative technology solutions that help us become an end-to-end, next-generation financial services company.Join us if you want to grow your technical skills, solve real problems and make your mark on our industry.Who we are looking forWe are looking for a lead business systems analyst to lead efforts in analyzing business requirements for market and credit risk focused on FX/FI derivative trading. The successful candidate is expected to be able to translate these business requirements into broken down functional components as well as guide the creation of a test strategy to validate if the requirements are met. The scope of the position covers the banks trading activities primarily in the FX/FI trading and secondarily on trading activities of exchange traded instruments.What you will be responsible forAs Lead Business Systems Analyst you will be responsible forEnvisioning functional implementation of new risk and regulatory processes in the context of the functional and technical framework for optimal delivery and time to market.Analyze and present trade-offs to manage the balance of tactical delivery for emerging regulatory and risk needs Vs strategic objectives.Provide well thought through end to end design along with testing and validation strategy that complies with State Street business, technical, data, security and operational guidelines.Work with various stakeholders on the business side such as operational risk managers, regulatory submission teams, data quality office and IT implementation teams to elicit requirements and formulate them Agile stories for implementation.Provide functional and test strategy guidance to the IT implementation teams to build defensive, fault tolerant and scalable solutions to business problems.What we valueThese skills will help you succeed in this roleStrong team ethics and team player - Work with team members and business partners to stay focused on project objectives and subject matter to resolve potential conflicts in a non-confrontational manner.Well organized and have the patience and tenacity to start with project objectives defined at high level and come up with approach including functional design and data needs. Ability to visualize the problem and show the solution path through examples of data relatable to business partners and development team.Strong whiteboarding skills to be able to present in front of business and IT team members. Ability to simplify and explain complex concepts to the team.Education & Preferred QualificationsBachelors degree in a technical area such as Math, Statistics, CS, Engineering or Physics with quantitative skills. Masters degree preferred.10+ years experience in the technical aspects of OTC derivatives in front office and risk.The role will require understanding of various risk measurement methodologies and their technical implementation for OTC and security lending markets [e-g VaR, PFE, Expected Shortfall] and regulatory processes.Experience and understanding of the OTC derivative products such as FX Forwards, Options, IR Swaps specifically, the usage of market data for pricing and simulationExperience in designing systems with stringent data quality needs for regulatory processes such as CCAR, RCAP etc.Proficiency in SQL and the ability to backtrace aggregated data measures back to underlying data through process transformations to troubleshoot issues.Why this role is important to usOur technology function, Global Technology Services (GTS), is vital to State Street and is the key enabler for our business to deliver data and insights to our clients. We’re driving the company’s digital transformation and expanding business capabilities using industry best practices and advanced technologies such as cloud, artificial intelligence and robotics process automation.We offer a collaborative environment where technology skills and innovation are valued in a global organization. We’re looking for top technical talent to join our team and deliver creative technology solutions that help us become an end-to-end, next-generation financial services company.Join us if you want to grow your technical skills, solve real problems and make your mark on our industry.About State StreetWhat we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary in locations, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Program to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspective are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome the candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift program and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.Discover more at StateStreet.com/careers

GENERAL SUMMARY/ OVERVIEW STATEMENT: Summarize the nature and level of work performed.

Reporting to the Finance Manager, DACCPM, the Business Analyst contributes to the management and understanding of the $100M+ budget and expenses within the DACCPM. Work relates directly to the specific needs and strategic goals of the clinical leaders as aligned with the mission of the department and the hospital.

This individual brings attention to detail and ingenuity to various tasks including financial modeling, financial impact analysis, expense and revenue forecasting, and ad hoc reports. The financial analyst will manage existing reporting vehicles and create new ones as necessary to communicate key metrics and concepts to a variety of audience members.

The DACCPM is a constantly growing and evolving collaborative department and this individual may be called upon to lend expertise to other ongoing work both within the department and the hospital. The work done at MGH often informs larger initiatives at Mass General Brigham (formerly Partners Healthcare) and member institutions. New ideas and approaches are encouraged and welcomed in all aspects of work.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Indicate key areas of responsibility, major job duties, special projects and key objectives for this position. These items should be evaluated throughout the year and included in the written annual evaluation.

Monthly Financial Reporting

Prepare a monthly summary of budget variances to be reported to Senior Vice PresidentPrepare a monthly operating budget review and present to DACCPM leadership

Annual Capital and Operating Budget

Participate in the creation of the capital budget and the operating budget each year

OR Cost Awareness

Patriciate in the OR Cost Awareness effort with new approaches and projects aimed at increasing awareness of cost drivers in the Operating Room and reduction of variation in surgical costs.

Additional Duties and Functions:

Researches all data issues with appropriate representatives from other departments and affiliates.Accommodate the varying needs of the department on as needed basis.Develops customized reports to address specific questions raised, summarizing findings in report or presentation format.

Qualifications

QUALIFICATION: (MUST be realistic, neither overstated nor understated, and related to the essential functions of the job.)

Must possess a college degree (Bachelors) with 2-4 years' experience in a business setting, healthcare experience preferable, but not necessary. Exposure to large complex businesses preferred.

SKILLS/ ABILITIES/ COMPETENCIES REQUIRED: (MUST be realistic, measurable, objective, and related to the essential functions of the job.)

Knowledge of Financial analysis preferred

Ability to work independently, prioritizing multiple tasks

Ability to read, analyze and interpret financial and operation data

Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions

Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from management

Strong working knowledge of database (Access, SQL Server), financial (Excel) and data visualization (Tableau) software a must

Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently

Strong interpersonal skills

WORKING CONDITIONS: Describe the conditions in which the work is performed.

Desk work with some travelling to/from Main Campus from Nashua Street location. Partner's Healthcare is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

TriNetX is the Global Health Research Network for Healthcare Organizations (HCOs), Biopharma & CROs. We optimize clinical research and enable discoveries through the creation of Real World Evidence (RWE). TriNetX combines real-time access to longitudinal clinical data with state-of-the-art analytics to answer complex research questions at the speed of thought. Our health research community connects clinical researchers in real-time to the patient populations they study.

As a business analyst on our product management team, you will work to deliver features on TriNetXs product roadmap. You will gather and refine business requirements, define product specifications, and guide cross-functional teams to develop new product functionality.

A successful business analyst at TriNetX:

Focuses on the customer to understand their underlying needsOwns the quality of the features they work on and takes pride in their workUses good judgment and anticipates the consequences of their decisionsIs curious and quickly learns new topicsCollaborates effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and perspectivesHolds themselves and others to high standardsKeeps pace with our fast-moving organization

Possible day-to-day responsibilities:

Define product requirements in collaboration with design and engineering Break down large features into epics and stories to deliver incremental valueCommunicate feature value and requirements to engineering teams via stories, acceptance criteria, and grooming sessions; provide clarification on requirements throughout the development cycleManage product backlog to prioritize feature development and bug resolutionCollaborate with scrum teams to groom product backlog and plan development sprintsCommunicate release timelines to internal stakeholdersReview features prior to release to ensure they will bring value

What you bring to the table:

3+ years of experience as a business analyst working with agile engineering teamsStrong background in linked data setsStrong communication skills in both speech and writing; able to precisely communicate complex ideas to technical and non-technical audiences Ability to motivate cross-functional teams to plan, scope, and deliver solutionsAttention to detail; capable of analyzing problems at a detailed level without losing sight of the big pictureBachelors degree in business, economics, health administration, engineering, sciences, or health informatics or related disciplineExperience in life sciences or biopharmaceutical industries is a plus

Our 3 teams located in the US, Poland, and Thailand work around the clock to build our PCRS platform that automates the full administration lifecycle of all extended warranties, F&I products, and service contracts for the automotive industry.You’ll be a part of our tight-knit group of 40 individuals in our Park Ridge office who pride ourselves on treating each other like family.PCMI’s employee benefits and perks are built around keeping you happy and healthy. We are committed to offering comprehensive packages that cover the spectrum of personal and professional needs to help our employees maintain a healthy work/life balance.BENEFITS:· Health and Dental insurance· Long Term Disability insurance· 401k with company matching· Paid time off· Paid holidays· Parental Leave· Annual Salary Review· Certification BonusesPERKS:· Lunch & Learns· Professional Development· Foodie Fridays· Daily Fruit· Frequent Outings and Celebrations· Fun Office Contests· Casual Attire· Open LayoutOur Park Ridge office is in walking distance from the Blue Line and located right off I-90/I-294.Job Type: Full-timeJob Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offParental leaveProfessional development assistanceReferral programSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:APIs: 1 year (Preferred)Business Analysis: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:One locationCompany's website:http://www.pcmicorp.com/Work Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

If you are a current Motorola Solutions employee, please click this link to apply through your Workday account.Company OverviewAt Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline. Our technology platforms in communications, software, video and services help our customers work safely and more efficiently. Whether it’s helping firefighters see through smoke, enabling police officers to see around street corners, or reliably keeping the lights on in homes and businesses around the world, our work supports those who put their lives on the line to keep us safe. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions, and help us usher in a new era in public safety and security.Department OverviewOn any given day, every moment matters to someone, somewhere. And every moment, Motorola Solutions’ innovations, products and services play essential roles in people’s lives.We help firefighters see around buildings and police officers see around street corners. We keep utility workers connected and visible to each other with real-time voice and data communication across the smart grid. And we provide the situational awareness first responders need when a moment brings catastrophe. We help people be their best in their moments that matter.Our IT organization isn’t just here to support our business. We’re here to reinvent it – by changing the way our customers, partners and employees interact with our company. To do that, we’re looking for people who bring great ideas and who make our partners’ ideas better. Intellectually curious advisors (not order takers) who focus on outcomes to creatively solve business problems. People who not only embrace change, but who accelerate it.Job DescriptionOur company is undergoing a CEO sponsored digital transformation to improve the way our customers and partners do business with us. We have a multi-billion dollar revenue model online today and we aspire to do more! As a Digital IT Business Analyst you are a key member of this team. This role will partner with our business leaders to create and implement technical & business process solutions to enable frictionless digital interactions, next gen product enablement and transform this company.Basic Responsibilities :As a Digital IT Business Analyst you will translate Motorola Solutions tactical and strategic objectives into workable capabilities and solutions.You will work as a liaison among stakeholders in order to elicit, research, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems.You will perform best-in-class benchmarking and identifies all possible solutions, performs cost-benefit analyses, implement solutions, and measure results.You are a self starter & visionary with an entrepreneurial spirit! We want and love new ideas to improve our business with that latest technology!Specific Responsibilities :Gather, investigate and create data insights in partnership with our business to leverage results in order to drive our digital transformation actions.Assist with defining and analyzing project scope and system requirements to meet both business and end-user needs.Gather data regarding a business unit’s or functional group’s business strategy and objectives.Assist with establishing the desired end state of a business unit or functional group.Gather, study, and document current practices, workflows, and business needs.Assess business needs and technical solutions to fill gaps in business desired state execution.Assess available technology and suggest alternatives.Assist with project scopes, timeframes, and budgets. Gathers and documents requirements.Inspect test plans to mitigate risks and to ensure the systems meet functional and performance requirements.Assist with a business unit’s or functional group’s short and long-term planningDesired Skills/Qualifications:Excellent communication (written / verbal), interpersonal , and management skills and able to work well within a team environmentAbility to communicate to a wide variety of audiences, both business and technicalDetail oriented, proactive, and demonstrates critical thinking and troubleshooting abilityExperience working in an agile environment (Preferred)Self starter, curious and eager to learn new technology and Marketing / Analytics business processesBasic RequirementsBachelors or Masters degree4+ years of experience as an IT Business AnalystTravel RequirementsNoneRelocation ProvidedNonePosition TypeExperiencedReferral Payment PlanYesEEO StatementMotorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.

Ardeo Education Solutions is seeking a Business Analyst – Underwriting & Analytics with a passion for data, who can identify relationships among complex information and can draw conclusions to make strategic recommendations. The position is located in our Lisle, Illinois office.At Ardeo, we’re creating positive change in the world by giving college-bound students the freedom to pursue their passions at their college of choice, while ensuring that educational loan debt doesn’t hold them back from the career of their dreams after graduation.Are you looking for a career with a company that’s driven by a powerful mission? At Ardeo, you’ll join a team of high performers looking to make a difference in the lives of students and families across the country. We help students have the freedom to realize their greatest ambitions, both on campus and after graduation, without the burden of educational loans.Why join Ardeo? Ardeo provides our unique, innovative Loan Repayment Assistance Program (LRAP) to colleges and universities across the country. We help students enroll in the college of their choice with the peace of mind to know that if their income after graduation is modest, we can help repay their educational loans.Why else? Ardeo is a fast-growing start-up full of dedicated, passionate individuals who delight in working for an organization that makes a difference in the lives of thousands of students and their families. Oh, and the comprehensive benefits package for full-time employees is nice too.Want to learn more about this great opportunity? Check out some of our recent blog posts about how our program is helping colleges and students, or visit myLRAP.org for more information.Position SummaryThis position adds value to the organization through insightful analysis & reporting, data-based recommendations, and overall management of key data sources. The successful candidate will be a lover of data, who can identify relationships among complex information and can draw conclusions to make strategic recommendations. It is a highly-visible role, fitting for someone with ambition and eagerness to dive-deep and truly have an impact on the business.Key Areas of ResponsibilitiesApply sound data analysis to assist in making business decisions using knowledge of business fundamentals.Develop an acute understanding of the business and the drivers of success to understand the needs and objective of our internal customers.Serve as an analytical resource and partner to support business analysis across all functions in the organization.Support Underwriting in data management and organization. Manage third-party data sources and refresh scheduling.Assist in maintaining and improving monthly reports, internal dashboards, and select client reporting deliverables.Position RequirementsBachelor’s degree in business/finance/statistics/analytics or related field and 2-5 years of experience.Highly skilled with Microsoft Excel, financial analysis, and modeling.Experience working with large datasets and relational databases.Basic understanding of statistics.Ability to work independently with a strong track record of setting and meeting delivery commitments.Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate with operations & sales/marketing team members.Comfort working with ambiguity, in a fast-changing business environment and with broad cross-functional teams.PreferredSQL experience a strong plus.Power BI experience a plus.Experience with statistical models (R, SPSS, SAS, etc..) a plus.Experience in the financial, insurance or higher education industry is preferredCompensation is commensurate with experience. Bankers' Bank is a fast-growing, state-chartered financial institution with over $1.1 billion in assets committed to assisting community banks with their payments and financial service needs for over 40 years. In addition to specializing in providing correspondent banking products and services to community banks we also provide bank holding company loans, commercial lending, leasing, secondary mortgage products, cash letter/cash management, investment trading, safekeeping and portfolio accounting, correspondent credit services, international services, and bank card products. WHO WE LOOK FOR

An SEI Consultant is a master communicator and active listener who understands how to navigate an audience. Self-aware, almost to a fault, SEI consultants keenly understand how to adjust their approach based on the situation. Following a logical, fact-based approach, our consultants possess the superior ability to see correlations others may not, ask the right questions and drive solutions.

As super-connectors, our consultants connect not only people, but data, trends and experiences. Mature, humble, and genuine, SEI Consultants frequently go above and beyond for both their clients and their colleagues. SEI Consultants are ethical and trustworthy individuals who do what they say. SEI Consultants have an insatiable curiosity and love to learn. These individuals are commonly tech savvy and early adopters. Their passion for learning is infectious and excites others.

As every project is different, an SEI Consultant must be adaptable and comfortable with unexpected situations. An SEI Consultant must be at ease with ambiguity because although a client knows that a problem exists – they need SEI to figure it out and drive a solution. SEI Consultants define ambition differently. SEI Consultants are authentic, low-maintenance individuals who like to hang out with colleagues outside of work. Whether it be cooking, traveling, hiking, or volunteering, SEI Consultants enjoy working with genuine, thoughtful folks who want to steer clear of the traditional grind and share the joy of day-to-day life and activities with colleagues, friends and family.

WHAT WE DO

Our consultants work with clients at all levels of the organization, from the C-suite to the shop floor, helping them to deliver on their most strategic initiatives. We’re known for making realistic, data-driven decisions that deliver value in tangible ways to our clients. Our clients ask for us on projects that require a superior combination of technical and business capabilities, people and management skills, and a collaborative mindset. We excel in understanding complex programs and strategic initiatives and breaking them into actionable pieces.We work across a variety of industries and business functions and provide depth and breadth of experience across a core set of service areas:

Agile Transformation and Delivery Analytics and Business Intelligence Business Process & Transformation Organizational Change Management Information Management & Data Governance Program & Project Leadership & Execution Strategic Planning Vendor & Technology Selection User Experience (UX)

A career at SEI extends well beyond providing great service and thought leadership to our clients. Everyone takes an active role in building and managing our business, in an environment that runs counter to traditional consulting firms. Our consultants have a "seat at the table" and contribute to growing our business in ways that align to their interests such as growing business development opportunities, conducting interviews to support our hiring process, managing internal initiatives that build our brand or organizing trainings to share what you know with your colleagues. There is no telling what an SEI Consultant will be asked to do on a day-to-day basis – we do what it takes to get the job done.

QUALIFICATIONS

Required

Demonstrated business acumen Proven track record of delivering results Experience working with and/or leading a team Ability to work independently Ability to work across industries, roles, functions & technologies Positive can-do attitudeAuthorization for permanent employment in the United States (this position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship)

Preferred

Bachelor’s degree Minimum 8+ years professional experience Consulting experience Experience across our service offerings Professional certifications (e.g. PMP , Scrum, Agile)

Systems Evolution, Inc. (SEI) is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

OVERVIEW

At Instacart we solve for the customer. That extends beyond the hundreds of thousands of consumers we deliver groceries to and includes many leading and emerging consumer packaged goods (CPG) advertisers that want to shape how consumers perceive, shop, and stay loyal to their brands. Instacart's Brand Partnerships team is focused on serving these clients through our native advertising platform.

We are hiring an Analyst to join the Sales Capability & Strategy team and lead the development of dashboards, tools, and analysis to ensure that leadership has the insights they need to measure the business. This work will range from building new leadership level dashboards in data visualization tools such as Tableau, to conducting one-off analysis to help identify and size a new revenue opportunity for the Ads business.

ABOUT THE JOB

Partner with Sales Leaders to design, development, and maintain of key dashboards needed to manage the business
Design, coordinate, and deliver periodic reporting to Instacart's Brand Partnership leadership team
Conduct ad hoc analysis, ranging from the development of new metrics to the identification of root causes for fluctuations in revenue
Work independently as the key resource for day-to-day analytic needs
Retrieve and aggregate data from multiple sources and compile it into a digestible and actionable format
Self motivated to Identifying opportunity to automate and scale reports

ABOUT YOU

3+ years work experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analyst role
Ability to write complex, efficient, and eloquent SQL queries to extract data
Strong experience with data visualization tools, preferably Tableau
Experience working with Salesforce data
Excellent attention to detail, follow-through, and resourcefulness
Ability to independently manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize responsibilities
Ability to work cross-functionally with many teams and multi-tasks with a sense of urgency
Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast-paced environment and a willingness to lend a helping hand wherever it's needed

Nice to Have…

Masters degree (MBA, Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field)
Advanced knowledge of data mining and experience with SQL, data warehousing, statistical analysis tools, Microsoft Excel, and data visualization tools such as Tableau; experience extracting and processing data using SQL and Excel
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills, and an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical team
Excellent organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management, and meeting deadlines
Exposure to and understanding of digital advertising
Experience working closely with a distributed sales team

As an E-Billing Analyst at Clyde, you will assist with the management of electronic billing for the US region. Founded on the principles of trust, experience, and innovation, Trexin Consulting specializes in strategy execution – the effective implementation of business strategy to achieve a specific business goal. Also referred to as applied strategy, strategy execution situations that Trexin frequently leads include: scaling capabilities for growth, optimizing operations for cost reduction, driving synergies for M&A, and recovering projects in distress. Trexin’s services are right-sized for our Clients’ needs, ranging from our “Diamond Team” service when our Clients want Trexin to own an outcome and share delivery risk, to Expert/Advisory services for senior-level guidance, to Strategic Staffing services for execution-oriented tasks and roles. job_title: Customer Interaction Analyst - Business Benefits and Strategy
description:
We're ALDI, one of America's favorite grocers. We've grown a lot in the past few years, expanding our reach and customer base all around the country. Whether it's in customer service or our exceptional products, we owe our success to the efficiencies we create in every corner of our company and the people at each level who make that happen.
We have a message to get out: we’re growing. Fast. ALDI is one of the fastest-growing retailers in the nation, and we are charting an aggressive growth course to become the third-largest U.S. grocery retailer by store count by the end of 2022. That’s why we need people dedicated to helping us connect with our new customers and keeping our current customers coming back for more! On our Marketing, Advertising and PR teams, you can do just that, showing the nation just what kind of company we are. With a thriving organization like ours, this can make for a rewarding career.
Position Type: Full-Time
Duties and Responsibilities:

Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation.Understands ALDI and ALDI Customer Interaction to effectively communicate with global teams and internal stakeholders.Communicates status and creates required project reporting for all appropriate participants.Analyzes quantitative business benefit metrics and strategizes on how to ensure adoption within the US business.Analyzes trends in quantitative metrics and makes recommendations when patterns emerge.Recommends process improvements for area of responsibility.Understands marketing and project requirements and responds accordingly.Performs all assigned tasks accurately, efficiently and within ALDI Customer Interaction policies and procedures.Works in a manner that is consistent with the policies and procedures outlined in the Office Employee Handbook.Liaises with the Business Strategy team and the country to drive achievement of the business benefits and global strategy plan.Creates and maintains communication channels between countries and central teams for the collection of feedback about business benefits.Works in a committee with the other Business Benefit/Strategy experts to align processes and best practice globally and implement this into the countries.Prepare executive-level recommendations and requested reports.Collaborates with team members and communicates relevant information to leadership.Upholds the security and confidentiality of documents and data within area of responsibility.
Education and Experience:Bachelor's Degree in Marketing or a related field.A minimum of 4 years of progressive experience in customer interaction.A combination of education and experience providing equivalent knowledge.Experience of working in an agile, project-based environment preferred.
Job Qualifications:
Knowledge/Skills/AbilitiesA self-starter with the ability to prioritize duties among multiple, concurrent projects.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Ability to communicate effectively across many levels of the business and work with cross-functional teams.Problem-solving skills.Thinks critically and analytically.Ability to translate mathematical information into concise reports.Develop and maintain positive relationships with internal personnel and external vendors.Understanding of business requirements and priorities.Reporting of progress to stakeholders (e.g. monthly to Deployment leads and Directors responsible for financial planning).Ability to travel internationally.
ALDI offers competitive wages and benefits, including:
401(k) Plan
Company 401(k) Matching Contributions
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
PerkSpot National Employee Discount Program
In addition, eligible employees are offered:
Medical, Prescription, Dental & Vision Insurance
Generous Vacation Time & 7 Paid Holidays
Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance
Life, Dependent Life and AD&D Insurance
Voluntary Term Life Insurance
Click here to learn more about the benefits ALDI has to offer
ALDI is committed to equal opportunity for all employees and applicants. As a proud Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE), we do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, religion, sex, sexual stereotyping, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, pregnancy (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), or any other protected characteristic. Ardeo Education Solutions is seeking a Business Analyst – Underwriting & Analytics with a passion for data, who can identify relationships among complex information and can draw conclusions to make strategic recommendations. The position is located in our Lisle, Illinois office.At Ardeo, we’re creating positive change in the world by giving college-bound students the freedom to pursue their passions at their college of choice, while ensuring that educational loan debt doesn’t hold them back from the career of their dreams after graduation.Are you looking for a career with a company that’s driven by a powerful mission? At Ardeo, you’ll join a team of high performers looking to make a difference in the lives of students and families across the country. We help students have the freedom to realize their greatest ambitions, both on campus and after graduation, without the burden of educational loans.Why join Ardeo? Ardeo provides our unique, innovative Loan Repayment Assistance Program (LRAP) to colleges and universities across the country. Ryan Specialty Group is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join our Chicago, IL office. We are a fast paced, energetic and rapidly growing organization that offers a great opportunity for someone interested in further developing their career. Ryan Specialty Group has been named one of the Best Places to Work 2020 by Business Insurance, and has been named 2020 top Insurance Workplace by Insurance Business America.

Position Summary:
Ryan Specialty Group provides niche services to an evolving marketplace of insurance needs. We are looking for IT/Business professionals seeking a seeking a career in a quickly expanding company. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be responsible for performing analysis required to support, maintain, and enhance company business processes and applications. In this role, you will be tasked to energize team members to think creatively about areas of improvements as well as utilize your own skillset to look across functional areas and pull together improvement ideas.

Essential Functions:
Conduct interviews and end-to-end process reviews to determine opportunities for development and process improvement
Work cross-functionally and collaboratively to solve business problems using data analysis to support strategic improvement
Find and create efficiencies in the form of time savings, cost savings, streamlining, or standardization
Challenge current state procedures and technology to identify potential areas of improvement
Oversee business requirement collection and ensure that requirements are met throughout all phases of the project lifecycle
Perform and/or coordinate User Acceptance testing as required
Contribute to vision of the future state of the company
Step into a leadership role within projects where required
Facilitate demos and training sessions to stakeholders when required
Participate in steering committee meetings and guide executives through decision processes
Work with development teams in an agile setting on software development projects
Provide limited support for end users on applications that are already in production
Education/Experience/Skills:
BA/BS degree in a technology or business-related field
Key participant in multiple successful deliveries of enterprise-class projects
Minimum of 5 years as a Business Analyst
Experience working with business users to develop functional requirements
Experience in the insurance industry a plus
Foundational understanding of relational database design and a working knowledge of SQL
Conceptual understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC)
Experience using wireframing software such as Balsamiq or equivalent
Experience mapping process flows in MS Visio or equivalent
Solid experience in the design, execution, and management of test plans and test cases
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Extremely detail-oriented
Disclaimer
Ryan Specialty Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer

job_title: Analyst, Finance - Revenue Management, Sales RMX
description:
About Us
The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. While Kraft Heinz is co-headquartered in Chicago and Pittsburgh, our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.
We spark joy around mealtime with our iconic brands, including Kraft, Oscar Mayer, Heinz, Philadelphia, Lunchables, Velveeta, Planters, Maxwell House, Capri Sun, Ore-Ida, Kool-Aid, Jell-O, Primal Kitchen, and Classico, among others.
No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally . Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and let’s make life delicious!
Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy & Collaboration
We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day. As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.

SALESFORCE BUSINESS ANALYST - REMOTE
A National professional services firm is actively seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join their growing Salesforce Practice. As the Salesforce Business Analyst you will be responsible for project work stream delivery, work plan management, analytics, reporting and client interfacing/presentations. You will collaborate closely with the client staff and leadership while managing and will gain valuable, hands-on consulting experience and world-class training and development. The ideal candidate will be a skilled relationship builder who implement best practices in the selection, planning and implementation of leading enterprise software and analytics solutions.
Excellent communication skills are required as is the ability to travel in 2022.

Bachelor's Degree in MIS, Computer Science or IT Related
2+ years as a Business Analyst

2+ years of experience in with Salesforce.com, ideally an implementation of Salesforce

Extensive experience in writing BRD, Functional Specification documents and Process flows.
Extensive experience in conducting Feasibility Studies, Gap Analysis and Root Cause Analysis (RCA)
Exposure/experience with Quality Assurance testing including: functional, integration, system, regression, and data driven testing experience in creating and developing strategic test plans, cases and reports
In-depth understanding of the capabilities and constraints of the SFDC CRM application
Experience defining business solutions leveraging SFDC
Practical experiences in the entire SDLC from solution definition, solution architecture definition to design, development and testing of the SFDC application

Experience in developing SFDC custom objects and work-flow business rules
Experience with third-party tools (e.g. SFDC Excel Connector, SFDC Data Loader, etc.)
In-depth understanding of SFDC toolkit (e.g. Visual force, Apex, Triggers, Chatter, Apex Data Loader, Apex Explorer, etc.)
Ability to manage work of remote Salesforce Developers
Should have knowledge in Data Migration and Integration (SSO and web services)
Applied knowledge of the solution definition, design, layout and configuration of the SFDC implementation and related applications
Recommend cost effective technology solutions for business challenges
Ensure the on-time delivery of enhancements or modifications to ongoing production CRM systems.
Salesforce.com Certifications are a plus

The Senior business systems analyst will play an integral role within a highly collaborative Agile team in working with internal clients and stakeholders to identify, define, prioritize, and implement BPM (Business Process Management) projects that deliver value through business process re-engineering and process automation, which meet both customer and user expectation. During project execution, the Analyst will work as the key user and customer representative within the Development Team. In this capacity, the Analyst will participate in project planning, requirements gathering, development, and testing activities.

BS in Computer Science or equivalent professional education/work experience


5-7 years experience as a Business/Systems analyst
Strong communication skills (oral and written)
Experience creating BPM workflows models and documenting their requirements
Experience designing user interfaces
Experience analyzing and documenting internal and external APIs (SOAP, REST)
Experience working in an Agile environment

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Work with end users and other stakeholders to identify business requirements. Using the gathered information, the Analyst will document the new features and User Stories (including acceptance criteria) for detailed planning
Assist in identifying short term improvements that align with business/program goals and recommend longer term solutions
Present alternatives to users and impacted areas to facilitate design decisions and gain consensus
During planning, facilitate story estimation sessions with the developers and prioritize stories with key stakeholders. Break-down stories, identify non-functional requirements and prepare additional tasks to ensure that non-functional requirements are met. Work the project managers and end users in determining a release schedule.
Liaise with other project teams to identify and capture constraints, dependencies, assumptions, and risks
Throughout the execution of project, meet with development team members to answer questions, clarify requirements, and review/verify the implemented solution. Work closely with Testers and Developers to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the specified system behaviors (acceptance criteria). At the end of the development, verify the functionality and scope of testing based on requirements.
Conduct formal reviews or demo/showcase the new functionality to key stakeholders and obtain sign-off; gather new requirements identified during these sessions.
Report, track, and communicate project status and issues/blockers
Create test plans and participate in testing of software application
Assist others in facilitating or lead end user training and system documentation for new implementations. Prepare appropriate procedures and documentation to hand-off support to super users, system administrators, or support groups
Document process models and other artifacts

Qualifications Required :
DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE


Knowledge of the BPM methodology
Experience working within an Agile team
Strong knowledge of the SDLC
Extensive experience gathering and documenting technical and functional requirements for information technology projects
Ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing, to interact effectively with internal clients, peers, management and cross-functional areas, to clearly and concisely communicate technical information to non-technical audience
Extensive experience coordinating and deploying technical products to end users
Ability to draw out information and develop in-depth understanding of complex processes
Ability to manage time effectively, to meet schedules and deadlines, to work under time pressure, and to pay close attention to detail
Functional/domain knowledge of BPM (Business Process Management) would be a plus

EDUCATION

BS Degree in Computer Science or related technical field is desired

About CCC
CCC Information Services Inc. is the technology platform for the underwritten assets economy. CCC technology, insights, and support connect industries – insurers, automotive manufacturers, collision repairers, parts suppliers, lenders, fleet operators and more – to advance decision-making, productivity, and customer experiences for thousands of clients worldwide. Clients leverage CCC’s network management, data management, AI, operational workflows and customer experience solutions to efficiently scale, interact, transact and achieve their unique business objectives. CCC was ranked a best mid-sized company to work for by Forbes (2019). BuiltIn Chicago, Austin and LA named CCC a top place to work in 2020. Diverse perspectives and experiences are core to CCC’s success and award-winning culture of more than 2,000 employees worldwide. We hold inclusion as a core value and are committed to celebrating and cultivating the diversity of our team. With a 40+ year track record of innovation, CCC’s tenacious spirit and growth mindset turn next generation technology into real world solutions and empower team members to expand their knowledge and potential. Headquartered in Chicago, CCC has 11 locations worldwide. CCC’s principal PE investors are Advent International, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Oak Hill Capital Find out more about CCC Information Services by visiting cccis.com.
Job Description Summary
The Business Consulting Analyst at CCC Information Services is part of the Solutions & Consulting group and plays a critical role in supporting the Insurance Services Group. CCC's consultants provide support to clients as partners in optimizing their operations. Consultants support CCC sales and account managers by recommending process improvement solutions, developing strategies, and building business cases to justify investment in CCC's products. CCC’s consultants serve as the eyes and ears to our market and identify opportunities to enhance CCC’s product suite by working with the broader CCC team to bring new and enhanced solutions to market. CCC’s Solutions & Consulting Practice is made up of individuals that leverage their management consulting experience and skills to drive value creation for CCC’s clients. The ideal candidate will bring structure, critical thinking, and creative solutions to the organization. He /she will be highly organized and detailed oriented. He/she will have a positive attitude, strong consulting skills and be able to plan and prioritize multiple projects. He/she will ensure project deadlines are understood and being met and will set appropriate expectations with the customer or prospect.
Job Duties
Leverage strategic and operational business consulting skills to help clients improve their financial outcomes, operational efficiencies, and customer satisfaction
Partner with prospective and current customers to identify and evaluate opportunities for performance improvement and provide actionable recommendations
Analysis of large data sets to provide actionable insights to clients
Development of value proposition material for CCC product suite
Development of repeatable client engagement material both for internal and external projects (i.e. process reviews, sales approach, software pilots, etc.)
Work with CCC’s Product Development organization to identify and request solution enhancements
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required
STEM, Finance, or Business majors preferred
Adept at business case requirement gathering, including ability to confidently draw out necessary data by asking questions that lead to meaningful conclusions
Ability to identify and evaluate performance improvement opportunities, leveraging financial and operational metrics
Exceptional communication and presentation skills with comfort presenting information to clients
Advanced aptitude in Excel and PowerPoint is required with the ability to draw insights from large data sets
Experience with Tableau or other Business Intelligence / Data Visualization software preferred
Attention to detail in order to deliver high quality deliverables in a timely manner
Creative thinker with strong problem-solving skills that can work independently to resolve issues
Knowledge of the insurance claims process, particularly Auto Physical and Auto Casualty verticals a plus, but not required

description:

Overview

Would you like to flex your "sales muscles" in a dynamic, fast-paced environment? Are you ready to challenge yourself by working with some of the top sales executives at Deloitte? We are seeking candidates for our Business Development Analyst (BDA) position, part of the Ecosystems & Alliances portfolio, that will interface with some of the largest, and most sophisticated companies in the industry - our Alliance partners!

This is a unique opportunity. It might be the right fit for you if:

You understand that you choose your attitude each day and look for the best in people and situations.
You manage the heck out of any project. Period.
You pay attention to details. You dot your i's and cross your t's.
You thrive in fast-paced environments. Your competitive spirit and passion for winning is off the charts. You hate to lose (while remaining a good sport).

The Team
The Sales Center of Excellence (COE) supports Deloitte's businesses in uncovering, nurturing, and closing sales opportunities. Working hand-in-hand with Partners, Principals and Managing Directors, these sales executives focus their highly skilled efforts in securing relationships with qualified targets and decision makers to uncover opportunities, develop effective sales strategies, manage the pursuit process and act as a key advisor to the pursuit team throughout the sales process.
Work You'll Do:
The Business Development Analyst (BDA) will work with the Channel Sales Management (CSM) and Sales Executive teams assigned to an alliance and will be at the front lines of the sales process. The BDA will perform a wide variety of activities focused on managing incoming sales leads, qualifying them, and providing handoff and support to the appropriate sales team as needed throughout the sales process. The Business Development Analyst will develop deep knowledge of their alliance(s), the Deloitte CSM team and alliance's sales team, and develop strong relationships with the appropriate Deloitte offering team. The role involves:

Establishing contact with identified leads by phone and monitoring progress
Qualifying leads and sharing relevant marketing and/or eminence materials to develop the lead
Providing a strong lead and hand-off to the Sales Executive team
Partnering with the CSM to develop sales opportunities for the Sales Executives & Service Line
Building strong cross-functional relationships with all members of the alliance team
Staying current with alliance news, trends and hot topics
Supporting CSM team in monitoring and sharing relevant thought leadership, client & marketplace news, and alliance materials
Proposing ideas for alliance team to connect with clients, including customization of Deloitte eminence materials and distribution of relevant thought-leadership to key stakeholders

Required Skills:
You can talk to anyone about anything, especially over the phone. Your communication skills are unparalleled.
You're an excellent writer. You speak clearly and with persuasion.
You're self-motivated to knock it out of the park every single time, regardless who's watching.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree
Minimum 3 years' experience
Exceptional relationship building/relationship management skills to establish rapport, trust and confidence with alliance teams, sales teams, and clients
Excellent written and oral communications skills and interpersonal skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite - strong PowerPoint and Excel skills critical
Quick learner with high energy and creative problem-solving skills
Detail oriented, ability to adapt to changing environment
Energetic, enthusiastic and organized
Demonstrated ability to take initiative and interact with all levels of management
Ability to work autonomously while being a team player
Travel up to 25% (While 25% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice).
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

5+ years of experience as a Product Owner, Business Analyst or Systems Analysis

Expert in writing project and process documentation
Strong written and verbal communication skills with an emphasis on technical writing
Highly organized and process-driven
Excellent time-management skills and impeccable follow-through
Resourceful—Able to identify unique solutions to solve complex challenges with limited direction and time
