Convoy is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Our mission is to transport the world with endless capacity and zero waste. The industry is huge and so is the opportunity to change the way freight moves.The next time you’re out driving and see an 18-wheeler on the road, that truck is empty 35% of the time. When big trucks drive empty, they throw unnecessary CO2 into the atmosphere. In fact, empty trucks generate more than 76 million metric tons of wasted carbon emissions every year. At Convoy, our digital freight network helps reduce those empty miles and cut carbon waste by nearly half.This is your opportunity to collaborate with an incredible group of people and help transform the freight industry. Join Convoy and help move the world forward.About you:As an HR Business Analyst at Convoy, you are eager to get your foot in the door at a fast-paced, rapidly growing startup. HR at Convoy is transparent and data driven so our business must have quality information to make the best decisions for our employees. We aim to be regarded as trusted advisors and thought leaders by our business partners. You will be responsible for ensuring we have high quality people data and have ownership of the total employee lifecycle: how Convoy attracts, develops, and retains the world’s best employees.This role will have a wide range of responsibilities that include compensation, benefits, diversity, and development. If you are curious minded and are passionate about joining a company that is using data to build the best people team, join us!You will:Perform analysis and reporting that is flexible and scalable as we grow.Drive clarity on trends and goal tracking in support of strategic initiatives.Help develop foundational processes that enable our teams to move fast and make high ROI decisions for Convoy.Resolve high-priority issues rapidly and effectively.We're looking for someone who has:3+ years of experience in Finance or Data Analyst RolesA love for working with numbers and comfort with Excel modelingExcellent communication skills that can flow across a wide range of partnersThe ability to break down high-level business problems into concrete analytical solutions, and to assess costs, benefits, and risks for the organizationSuperior organizational and time management skills, and the ability to prioritize workload and manage multiple projects and tasksHigh levels of responsibility working with sensitive informationAn interest in Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion workNice to have:Experience with SQL, R, and/or PythonExperience working with a BI tool (Tableau preferred)Experience with building Workday custom reportsStrong math or statistics backgroundCompensation experienceExperience working with sensitive or confidential dataBenefits:Employees' wellbeing is top of mind for the Convoy team. Outside of offering excellent medical, dental, and vision benefits, we also offer the following:On demand mental and emotional health benefits through LyraOn demand primary care through 98.6Generous paid time offPaid parental leave programFertility benefit solutions via ProgynyChild-care and adult/elder-care options through Bright HorizonsOpportunity to join and contribute to one of our Employee Resource GroupsAbility to make a real world impact!Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

Individuals within the Business Analyst role identify business intelligence, reporting, and data analysis needs. They work closely with clients and technology teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. It is essential that Business Analysts build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to identify and address critical issues. They provide data that is accurate, congruent and reliable, and ensure the information is easily available to users for direct consumption or integration with other systems.Educate and train clients to use the data as an analytical tool, displaying the information in new forms and content for the purpose of analysis and option exploration.Work with clients to determine business requirements, priorities, define key performance indicators (KPI), and develop BI and data warehouse (DW) strategy. This includes working with business and development teams to design and document dashboards, alerts, and reports.Accountable for providing leadership and independent initiatives in facilitating information gathering, creating structured documentation and presenting findings to all levels of management.Conduct analyses of functional business processes and functional business requirements and participate in the development of business cases in the support of process changes and/or technology projects.Understand how data is turned into information and knowledge and how that knowledge supports and enables key business processes.Must have an in-depth understanding of the business environment and an interest in going beyond the obvious, delving into the source, the definition, philosophy, and foundational roots of a data element in order to create information.They must work well within a team environment.QUALIFICATIONSBS or BA degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Finance, Statistics, Engineering, Supply Chain or Business Operations.
